title: KAVA POTENTIATORS DATASHEET
source: Reconstructed from 2020 KavaForums Thread + Current Research
project: Temple Pharmacopoeia Project - Reconstructing the Potentiates Thread

overview.title: The Oilahuasca Principle Applied to Kava
overview.description: Just as Ayahuasca combines DMT with MAOIs to prevent breakdown, kava can be potentiated by targeting the enzymes and receptors involved in kavalactone metabolism and activity. Kava already contains FAAH and MAGL inhibitors (as established in the 2020 thread), plus yangonin binds CB1 at 720 nM - comparable to endocannabinoids. The key is understanding which compounds enhance these pathways.

systems.mechanism: Kavain, dihydrokavain, methysticin, dihydromethysticin, yangonin all potentiate GABA-A receptors
Yangonin binds CB1 at Ki 720 nM (comparable to 2-AG at 472 nM)
All six major kavalactones reversibly inhibit MAO-B
Kavalactones inhibit FAAH and MAGL (preserves anandamide and 2-AG)
Methysticin and dihydromethysticin are potent CYP inhibitors (2C9, 2C19, 3A4)
Kavain and methysticin block voltage-gated channels

category_1_GABA_transaminase_inhibitors.title: GABA-Transaminase Inhibitors
category_1_GABA_transaminase_inhibitors.rationale: GABA-T breaks down GABA. Inhibiting it allows GABA to remain in the synapse longer, synergizing with kava's GABA-A potentiation.

botanicals.name: Lemon Balm (Melissa officinalis)
botanicals.active_compounds: Rosmarinic acid, Ursolic acid, Oleanolic acid
botanicals.mechanism: Rosmarinic acid inhibits GABA-T at IC50 0.35 mg/mL (40% inhibition at 100 µg/mL). Also inhibits AChE. Already used in Kava Candy commercially.

botanicals.name: Valerian (Valeriana officinalis)
botanicals.mechanism: High affinity for GABA-A receptors, inhibits GABA-T. Combined with Lemon Balm normalizes brain GABA and glutamate levels.

botanicals.name: American Skullcap (Scutellaria lateriflora)
botanicals.mechanism: GABA-A positive allosteric modulator. User reports: 'makes the effect smoother, takes the edge off'

category_2_CYP450_inhibitors.title: CYP450 Enzyme Inhibitors (Bioavailability Enhancers)
category_2_CYP450_inhibitors.rationale: CYP enzymes metabolize kavalactones. Inhibiting them slows breakdown and increases blood levels. This is the 'Parsley in the Werewolf Spell' principle.

botanicals.name: Black Pepper (Piper nigrum)
botanicals.mechanism: Inhibits CYP3A4, CYP2C9, CYP1A2 and P-glycoprotein. 20mg/day increased carbamazepine AUC by 47%. Kava's cousin plant.

botanicals.name: Grapefruit
botanicals.mechanism: Potent irreversible CYP3A4 inhibitor. Classic bioavailability enhancer. Also aids kavalactone extraction.

botanicals.name: Turmeric (Curcuma longa)
botanicals.mechanism: Inhibits multiple CYPs and SULTs. Raises brain anandamide levels. Best combined with piperine (20x bioavailability increase).

botanicals.name: Cinnamon/Vanilla
botanicals.mechanism: Glutathione breaks down kavalactones. These modulate glutathione activity. From 2020 thread discovery.

category_3_FAAH_inhibitors.title: FAAH Inhibitors (Endocannabinoid Preservation)
category_3_FAAH_inhibitors.rationale: FAAH breaks down anandamide. Since kava already contains FAAH inhibitors and yangonin hits CB1, additional FAAH inhibition amplifies the cannabimimetic effects.

botanicals.name: Ginger (Zingiber officinale)
botanicals.mechanism: 6x more potent FAAH inhibitor than kaempferol. Also anti-inflammatory.

botanicals.name: Maca (Lepidium meyenii)
botanicals.mechanism: Structurally similar to anandamide. Confuses FAAH enzyme. Also inhibits anandamide uptake (IC50 670 nM).

botanicals.name: Kaempferol Foods (Broccoli, kale, tea)
botanicals.mechanism: Competitive FAAH inhibitor (Ki 5 µM). 95% inflammation reduction in studies. Also in green tea.

botanicals.name: Biochanin A Sources (Red clover, soy)
botanicals.mechanism: Significant anandamide hydrolysis inhibition at 0.5 µM. From Fabaceae family (prenylated isoflavones are potent FAAH inhibitors).

category_4_endocannabinoid_reuptake_inhi.title: Endocannabinoid Reuptake Inhibitors
category_4_endocannabinoid_reuptake_inhi.rationale: These prevent anandamide and 2-AG from being removed from the synapse, amplifying CB1/CB2 signaling.

botanicals.name: Black Pepper (Piper nigrum)
botanicals.mechanism: Nanomolar endocannabinoid uptake inhibitor (EC50 290 nM). Does NOT inhibit FAAH/MAGL - purely blocks reuptake. 95% inflammation reduction at 2.5 mg/kg.

botanicals.name: Echinacea (Echinacea spp.)
botanicals.mechanism: Contains anandamide-like compounds. WOBE437 (selective eCRI) was derived from Echinacea 2,4-dodecadienamide scaffold.

category_5_CB2_agonists.title: CB2 Agonists (Peripheral Cannabinoid Enhancement)
category_5_CB2_agonists.rationale: While yangonin hits CB1, adding CB2 agonists provides anti-inflammatory and immune-modulating effects without psychoactivity.

botanicals.name: Black Pepper
botanicals.mechanism: Dietary CB2 agonist (7-35% of black pepper EO). FDA GRAS. Also in cloves, hops, rosemary, oregano.

botanicals.name: Uziza Leaf (Piper guineense)
botanicals.mechanism: Kava's cousin (Piperaceae family). African spice. High in caryophyllene.

botanicals.name: Acmella oleracea (Toothache Plant)
botanicals.mechanism: Highly active CB2 agonist AND FAAH inhibitor. Dual mechanism.

botanicals.name: Raw Garlic
botanicals.mechanism: Allicin (forms after crushing). CYP inhibition, antimicrobial, detox.
botanicals.user_reports: 'Strongest potentiator I have ever experienced.' Must be organic, crushed 10 min before use.

botanicals.name: Cacao
botanicals.mechanism: Contains anandamide. MAO-B inhibition (theobromine). Serotonin precursors.
botanicals.user_reports: Traditional combination. Theobromine mentioned in 2020 thread.

botanicals.name: Chamomile
botanicals.mechanism: Apigenin (GABA-A binding). Flavonoids.
botanicals.user_reports: 'Hot herbal teas kick it into high gear.' Sedative synergy.

botanicals.name: Kanna (Sceletium tortuosum)
botanicals.mechanism: SSRI, PDE4 inhibitor. Mesembrine alkaloids.
botanicals.user_reports: 'Known potentiator of other herbs.' Increases euphoria. Use caution with MAOIs.

botanicals.name: Blue Lotus (Nymphaea caerulea)
botanicals.mechanism: Aporphine alkaloids. D1/D2 dopamine modulation.

botanicals.name: Passionflower (Passiflora incarnata)
botanicals.mechanism: MAOI activity (harmine, harmaline). GABA-A.
botanicals.user_reports: 'Works really well with kava presumably from the MAOI quality.'

botanicals.name: California Poppy (Eschscholzia californica)
botanicals.mechanism: GABA-A binding. Mild opioid receptor activity.
botanicals.user_reports: Combined with passionflower and skullcap for kava synergy.

botanicals.name: Mucuna pruriens
botanicals.mechanism: L-DOPA precursor. Dopamine synthesis.
botanicals.user_reports: From 2020 thread potentiator stack. Synergizes with kava's NE reuptake inhibition.

botanicals.name: Ginkgo biloba
botanicals.mechanism: PEP/PREP inhibitor. Protects oxytocin from cleavage.
botanicals.user_reports: 2020 thread: Oxytocin as PAM. Also cerebral blood flow.

botanicals.name: Black Seed Oil (Nigella sativa)
botanicals.mechanism: Thymoquinone. CYP interactions. p-Cymene.
botanicals.user_reports: 2020 thread potentiator. 'Blessed seed' in Islamic tradition.

preparation_methods.classic_forum_advice: 'The best potentiator for kava is more kava' - reverse tolerance/accumulation effect

black_pepper_ultimate_potentiator.title: Why Black Pepper is the Ultimate Kava Potentiator
black_pepper_ultimate_potentiator.family_relationship: Black pepper (Piper nigrum) is kava's cousin in the Piperaceae family

four_mechanisms.action: Endocannabinoid reuptake inhibitor (290 nM) - amplifies yangonin's CB1 effects
CB2 agonist - adds peripheral cannabinoid effects

black_pepper_ultimate_potentiator.practical_application: This is why spicy food after kava works - you're literally administering the perfect potentiator cocktail.

cautions_and_contraindications.details: Both kava and CYP inhibitors affect the liver. Use noble varieties, water extraction, moderate doses.
Passionflower contains harmine/harmaline. Avoid tyramine-rich foods.
CYP inhibitors (grapefruit, piperine) affect drug metabolism. Consult healthcare provider.
Never combine with benzodiazepines, alcohol, or sedatives.
Potentiators can make kava unexpectedly strong. Reduce kava dose when experimenting.

key_concepts.oilahuasca_principle: Targeting enzyme inhibition to prevent breakdown and amplify effects
key_concepts.yangonin_CB1: Kava kavalactone with 720 nM CB1 binding affinity
key_concepts.piperaceae_family: Kava and black pepper are botanical cousins with complementary pharmacology
key_concepts.quadruple_mechanism: Black pepper hits CYP, reuptake, CB2, and P-gp simultaneously
